result.execSummary:
The defendant Peggy S Cornell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse per agent.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peggy S Cornell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peggy S Cornell in court with attorney Chad Kemp.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kemp says matter is resolved.  State states recs.  Atty Kemp notes there are other matters/cases to take care of today.  State notes they aren't ready to proceed w/all matters today.  Recess.  Back on the record Atty Kemp has received complaint in 15CM207 and waives reading.  Atty Kemp explains nonappearance at prior hearing.  Court quashes warrant in 15CM207.  State requests they proceed w/14CT525 today and the remaining cases be set over for a couple weeks for victim notification.  Court agrees and will proceed w/14CT525 today only.  Court sets all three matters, 15cm207, 15cm11 and 14cm638 for FPT.  Atty Kemp is ready to proceed today.  State suggests this be set over to the end of the calendar so her office can contact the victim.  Court resets to end of 1pm calendar.  Back on the record, Atty Linda Hoffman now appears for the State.  State states agreement.  Recess for Atty Kemp to fill out plea questionaires.  Back on the record, Atty Kemp enters Guilty pleas.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  State notes victim notification requirements have been met.  Atty Kemp has nothing to add.  DE makes brief statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

14CT525
Cts 1 and 4:  Guilty
Probation for 24 months on each count concurrent to each other
Ct 1:  70 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence (1st 48 hrs consecutive) 
To commence on or before 5/18/2015 at 4:00 pm
$2072.00 fine/costs/surcharges and $25.00 blood draw fees to be paid as a condition of probation
AODA (***DE to sign up today before leaving the courthouse***)
Revoke DL 29 months
IID for 29 months effective upon licensure
Ct 4:  $443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid per agent during probation
Conditions of probation:
Absolute sobriety at all times
Treatment/AODA per agent
Not to operate MV w/o valid DL
Cts 2 and 3:  Dismissed/read-in

14TR8867 is dismissed

14CM638
Ct 1:  Guilty
Ct 2:  Dismisss/read-in

15CM11
Ct 1:  Guilty
Cts 2-4:  Dismissed/read-in

15CM207
Ct 1:  Guilty
Cts 2-3:  Dismissed/read-in

Probation for 24 months on all three cases concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Costs of $543.00 x 3 to be paid during term of probation per agent
AODA/Treatment/Anger Management/Domestic Abuse counseling all per agent
3 days sentence credit on 14CM638 to be applied ONLY if revoked

State appears by Atty Sue Mueller.  DE appears in person w/Atty Chad Kemp.  Atty Chad Kemp states DE isn't ready to plea today as she has another matter pending they'd like to resolve too.  Court states all matters will be placed on the JT calendars.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Peggy S Cornell in court with attorney Joel Bruce Winnig.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls cases.  Matters all set for plea/sentencing on 3/16/2015.  Bonds continued in all matters.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on February 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on February 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Peggy S Cornell in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $150.00 Cash bond set.  AMEND Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/T.C. or residence; Absolute Sobriety; Not operate m/v w/o valid DL; May get belongings one time with law enforcement  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
